intro: Hancea nudipes, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees in south-eastern Australia. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length, and it produces small white or pale green flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while it provides nectar to attract insects for pollination. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that consume the fleshy, red berries. Hancea nudipes is a relatively rare and specialized species, making it an important part of the ecological balance in its native habitat.
